channel.title: attack.t1543.003 on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.t1543.003 on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Chafer Activity
item.description: Detects Chafer activity attributed to OilRig as reported in Nyotron report in March 2018

item.title: Suspicious Service Path Modification
item.description: Detects service path modification to PowerShell or cmd.

item.title: Turla PNG Dropper Service
item.description: This method detects malicious services mentioned in Turla PNG dropper report by NCC Group in November 2018

item.title: Turla Service Install
item.description: This method detects a service install of malicious services mentioned in Carbon Paper - Turla report by ESET

item.title: Suspicious Driver Load from Temp
item.description: Detects a driver load from a temporary directory

item.title: CobaltStrike Service Installations
item.description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement

item.title: CobaltStrike Service Installations in Registry
item.description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement. We can also catch this by system log 7045 (https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma/blob/master/rules/windows/builtin/win_cobaltstrike_service_installs.yml) In some SIEM you can catch those events also in HKLM\System\ControlSet001\Services or HKLM\System\ControlSet002\Services, however, this rule is based on a regular sysmon’s events.

item.title: Modification Of Existing Services For Persistence
item.description: Detects modification of an existing service on a compromised host in order to execute an arbitrary payload when the service is started or killed as a method of persistence.

item.title: Moriya Rootkit
item.description: Detects the use of Moriya rootkit as described in the securelist’s Operation TunnelSnake report

item.title: ProcessHacker Privilege Elevation
item.description: Detects a ProcessHacker tool that elevated privileges to a very high level

item.title: ServiceDll Modification
item.description: Detects the modification of a ServiceDLL value in the service settings

item.title: StoneDrill Service Install
item.description: This method detects a service install of the malicious Microsoft Network Realtime Inspection Service service described in StoneDrill report by Kaspersky

item.title: Suspicious Service DACL Modification
item.description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications that can be used to hide services or make them unstopable
